sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"奇怪的，奇异的，新奇的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: queer, odd, funny, crazy, curious, peculiar, strange, eccentric, quaint, singular
means: queer ： 指一种无法解释的怪诞，强调事物的奇特和不可思议。
odd ： 通常指不规律、偶尔出现的人或事物，往往令人困惑或奇怪。
funny ： 较通俗用词，指奇怪得滑稽可笑或反常。
crazy ： 多指与众不同的行为、外表或人与
物本身，含荒唐可笑或神经不正常的意味。
curious ： 通常指非常特别或能引起注意、研究或探索的奇特。
peculiar ： 侧重令人奇怪的或独一无二的特性，也指性格特征方面显著的与众不同之处。
strange ： 普通常用词，含义广泛，指陌生新奇、奇怪、奇怪或不自然的人或物。
eccentric ： 指偏离常规的怪异或怪癖。
quaint ： 指古色古香，会人感到既奇怪又有趣。
singular ： 通常指异常或奇特，暗含不同于一般。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun denoting a circle or orbit not having the earth precisely at its centre): via late Latin from Greek ekkentros, from ek 'out of' + kentron 'centre'

entry.def: If you say that someone is eccentric, you mean that they behave in a strange way, and have habits or opinions that are different from those of most people.

example.ex: He is an eccentric character who likes wearing a beret and dark glasses.
example.tran: 他人很怪，喜欢戴贝雷帽和墨镜。

example.ex: ...Mr Thomas, a businessman with eccentric views.
example.tran: 托马斯先生，一个想法怪异的商人

means.word_mean: 1. a person with an unusual or odd personality
2. a person of a specified kind (usually with many eccentricities);
1. conspicuously or grossly unconventional or unusual;

sentences.sentence: "restaurants of bizarre design--one like a hat, another like a rabbit"

means.word_mean: 2. not having a common center; not concentric;

auth_sentence.content: Turner was a fiercely private and often eccentric man.
auth_sentence.res_content: Turner was a fiercely private and often eccentric man.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Turner was a fiercely private and often eccentric man.

auth_sentence.content: It was an eccentric event, by our standards.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was an eccentric event, by our standards.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was an eccentric event, by our standards.

auth_sentence.content: His family was multilingual, well-read and very eccentric.
auth_sentence.res_content: His family was multilingual, well-read and very eccentric.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His family was multilingual, well-read and very eccentric.

stems_affixes.word_buile: a无+centric[[adj.中心的]]行牡摹鷄dj.无中心的
centri=centr中心+pet追+al……的→追求中心的→向心的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 古怪的,怪癖的,异乎寻常的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ec出+centric[[adj.中心的]]→adj.古怪的,怪癖的,异乎寻常的n.古怪的人
ego自我+centric[adj.中心的]→adj.自我中心的,利己的
xeno外国+centric[adj.中心的]→adj.喜爱外国之文化的
centre[n.中心, 中央 v.集中]→n.中心
centr中心+e→n.中心, 中央 v.集中
concentrate[v.集中;浓缩]+ion动作或状态→concentration集中;浓缩
ec出+centric[[adj.中心的]]→adj.古怪的,怪癖的,异乎寻常的n.古怪的人
eccentric[adj.古怪的,怪癖的,异乎寻常的n.古怪的人]+ity表名词→n.反常,怪癖
de离开+central[adj.中心的]+ize表动词→离开中心
centr中心+e→n.中心, 中央 v.集中
con共同+centr中心+ate做→中心共同→集中

Sentence.sentence: I turn to eccentric measures to try to keep my mind sober and ensure that I have time to do nothing at all (which is the only time when I can see what I should be doing the rest of the time).
Eccentric measures are needed to keep one's mind sober

means.word_mean: 古怪的, 怪癖的; 异乎寻常的

sentences.en: She is so eccentric that she is regarded as a bit of a curiosity.
sentences.cn: 她非常古怪, 算是个奇人。

jushi.english: Wearing evening gowns all day is just part of her eccentric behaviour.
jushi.chinese: 成天穿着晚礼服不过是她的古怪行为之一。

jushi.english: If you go to the palace in tennis shoes, they'll think you're rather eccentric.
jushi.chinese: 要是你穿着网球鞋去宫殿,人家一定会认为你有些古怪。
